input: Anne is big. Anne is blue. Anne is cold. Anne is furry. Anne is red. Anne is round. Anne is smart. Bob is cold. Bob is smart. Dave is furry. Erin is blue. Erin is cold. Erin is round. Erin is smart. If someone is smart and red then they are blue. If someone is cold and big then they are red. If Dave is smart and Dave is red then Dave is big. If Bob is round and Bob is furry then Bob is big. All round people are furry. All big people are red. Smart people are round. All big people are round. Furry people are big. Question: Bob is blue.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Bob : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Erin : obj

constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Big Anne
axiom T2 : Blue Anne
axiom T3 : Cold Anne
axiom T4 : Furry Anne
axiom T5 : Red Anne
axiom T6 : Round Anne
axiom T7 : Smart Anne
axiom T8 : Cold Bob
axiom T9 : Smart Bob
axiom T10 : Furry Dave
axiom T11 : Blue Erin
axiom T12 : Cold Erin
axiom T13 : Round Erin
axiom T14 : Smart Erin

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x ∧ Red x → Blue x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x ∧ Big x → Red x
axiom R3 : Smart Dave ∧ Red Dave → Big Dave
axiom R4 : Round Bob ∧ Furry Bob → Big Bob
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Round x → Furry x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Red x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Round x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Round x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Big x

theorem bob_is_blue : Blue Bob :=
begin
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T9,
  apply R6,
  apply R9,
  apply R5,
  apply R7,
  exact T9,
end

-- The answer is True
